triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: Primary social media platform being analyzed in the study to compare sampling methods and data collection approaches.

triples.name: Application Programming Interface
triples.relevance: The Streaming API is the primary data collection mechanism compared against the Firehose in this research.

triples.name: Social media
triples.relevance: Fundamental domain of study encompassing the microblogging phenomena and user-generated content being analyzed.

triples.name: Social network analysis
triples.relevance: Used to analyze and compare the network structures and relationships between tweets in both datasets.

triples.name: Statistical hypothesis test
triples.relevance: Statistical metrics and testing methods employed to validate differences between the Streaming API and Firehose datasets.

triples.name: Topic model
triples.relevance: Topic analysis technique used to compare and identify topical variations between the two data collection methods.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and evaluates a methodology for assessing the validity and representativeness of sampled Twitter data compared to complete streams.

triples.name: Spatial analysis
triples.relevance: Geographic analysis technique applied to compare location distributions and spatial patterns of tweets across both datasets.

triples.name: Streaming data
triples.relevance: The core data type being studied, including both the sampled Streaming API data and the complete Firehose stream.
